availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

body.p:
CONSOLIDATED MORNING REPORT OF Twenty Seventh Regt. Ky. Vols. Commanded by Col C D Pennebaker
DATE. Aug 23 1862 NOTE. -- All commissioned officers and enlisted men present on extra or daily duty will be borne in the column of "Present for Duty;" and all changes in the commissioned offivers will be noted in the column of Remarks, or on the back of the Return.

HEAD QUARTERS: 27th Ky Vols
STATION: Near Nashville Tenn
DATE: August 23d 1862

Alex Magruder Adjt.
C D Pennebaker
Commanding.

CONSOLIDATED MORNING REPORT
OF
COMMANDED BY
Station
Date

Manscroes Creek Aug 30/ 62
Hon Jas F Robinson

I herewith send you my morning report of 23d inst, I send this to Show the necessity of filling up my Regt. Genl Buell has only allowed me one officer to recruit whereas all others are allowed two. One cannot under existing circumstances fill up my ranks in a any while -- I cant do the work of a full regt with the men I have it will Kill them to do so. I was sent here after every one else had been whissed away with less than 250 men to contend with Morgan who is reported to have 2000. There is no better Regt in the service than mine as far as it goes -- I do myself and service injustice in my present condition, and I appeal to you to make Some arraingement that will allow me to send a corps home of sufficient force to fill me up for the fall campaign. I cant enter with my Regt as it is, I have all to loose and nothing to gain in a hopeless endeavor to sustain a Regt. with about a quarter of its force. I do not write this with a view of making complaint, for that wont do in the Army, but to appeal to your sound judgement in my behalf. My losses in sickness have been heavy and hospitals have treated me badly in discharging and furloughing men who ought to have been in the field --
On reflection col cotton told me the 6th was only allowed one recruiting officer.

Any suggestion you may make to Genl Buell with refference to filling up the old Regts I have every confidence will be carried out speedily -- They ought to be filled up at once -- I have 221 men sent to hospital between first of Apl & the date of this Report, to gather these up there ^the^ Genl only allowed me 20 days and two officers, time too short and force too small, & had I not been in such straitened circumstances I should not have made the detail unless by positive order to that effect -- It is reported that you intend to fill up the old Regts with drafted men will that not produce discord, between the old volunteer, and the new drafted levy -- He comes too late, & by force, it will be made a cause of quarrel; give officers ^&^ particulary colonels much anxiety & trouble.
HFeeling confident that you will take an enlightened view of this very important subject

I remain dear sir
your obt svt
C D Pennebaker
Col 27th Ky V
